title: Reduce Plastic Pollution with 'One Less Straw' - Oceanic Society
body: Here are 7 ways that you can help reduce ocean plastic pollution today. Changing one's habits is not easy, but you can get started by joining us in signing on to this campaign and pledging to reduce your plastic consumption one straw at a time.
readable_content: - The Oceanic Society, based in a coastal Californian town called Ross, is engaged in initiatives related to ecological conservation, wildlife preservation, and sustainable travel. The organization has partnered with 14-year-old Olivia Ries and her 15-year-old brother Carter, founders of the organization One More Generation, to support the global OneLessStraw Pledge Campaign. This initiative aims to reduce the usage of single-use plastic straws, which currently amounts to approximately 500,000,000 per day in the U.S. Oceanic Society emphasizes the detrimental impact of marine plastic pollution and encourages the reduction of plastic consumption through its Blue Habits Program. The organization also promotes seven ways to reduce ocean plastic pollution. (2023-12-08)
